It's entirely possible that I just did not order the right things (the right things seem to be the patatas bravas and baby squid dishes) but I thought that Quim was just ok in taste and too expensive in price.  And the couple next to me may or may not have found a piece of glass in one of their dishes..Ordered a truita of the day (todays omelette-pie featured onions) and pulpitos.  The onions in the truita were nicely sweated and the truita itself tender.  The pulpitos (baby octopus), €14, came 4 to a plate, sautéed/braised with caramelized onions.  Just a bit too chewy and the onions overly salty.  In general the various seafood plates are modest in size and will run you €12-20 each.On the plus side, it was kind of fun to sit and eat right amidst the hustle and bustle of La Boquería!
